intro: Diosma crenata, commonly known as the crested diosma, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, palmate leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Diosma crenata is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments.
